required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Safety and Efficacy of TWP-101 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumor
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Phase Ia/Ib, Open Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of TWP-101 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumor

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, phase Ia/Ib, open clinical study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of TWP-101 in patients with advanced solid tumor. This study consists of two parts (Part A and Part B). Part A was a dose escalation study, and Part B was a dose expansion study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the first dose of study drug up to 4 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events and serious adverse event (defined by the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events version 5.0 (CTCAE V5.0)) and irAE.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until 90 days after the last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate (ORR) by RECIST Version 1.1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to disease progression or end of study, an average of 2 years
From first dose to disease progression, an average of 2 years
From first dose to disease progression or end of study, an average of 2 years
From first dose to disease progression or end of study, an average of 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum measured plasma concentration (Cmax) of TWP-101.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose until 90 days after the last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to maximum plasma concentration (Tmax) of TWP-101.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose until 90 days after the last dose
From first dose until 90 days after the last dose
From first dose until 90 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected from subjects post treatment for assessment to detect the presence of anti-drug antibodies and neutralizing antibodies by meso scale discovery(MSD).

arm_group.description: Three dose levels of TWP-101 will be tested by a conventional 3 + 3 study design.
Once the effective dose has been determined, an expansion cohort will be opened to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the selected dose.
